Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Durvalumab Addition to Induction FOLFOX and Preoperative Chemotherapy in Locally Advanced Esophageal Adenocarcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either induction FOLFOX with durvalumab or FOLFOX alone

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were patients with locally advanced resectable esophageal/GEJ adenocarcinoma.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either induction FOLFOX with durvalumab or FOLFOX alone

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the safety and efficacy of adding the anti-PD-1 antibody durvalumab to this regimen.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was pathologic complete response (pCR) assessed post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using [randomisation method] with allocation concealment via [method].

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 36 patients were randomised, with 18 in each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: Thirty-three patients completed preoperative treatment and surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In the durvalumab group, pCR was achieved in 8 patients (22% [one-sided 90% lower bound: 13.3%]), and major pathologic response (mPR) in 22 patients (61% [one-sided 90% lower bound: 50%]).
